  • Constructor Details

    • VoltageSlider

      public VoltageSlider​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String displayName, VoltageModule module, boolean bIsVertical, double min, double max, double startValue, int numStops)
      Constructor
      Parameters:
      name - the internal name of the slider.
      displayName - the display name of the slider.
      module - the module this belongs to.
      bIsVertical - if true, this is a vertical slider.
      min - the min value for the slider.
      max - the max value for the slider.
      startValue - the starting value.
      numStops - if greater than 0, this will create a discrete number of stops.

    • VoltageSlider

      public VoltageSlider​(java.lang.String name, VoltageModule module, boolean bIsVertical, double min, double max, double startValue, int numStops)
      Constructor
      Parameters:
      name - the internal name of the slider.
      module - the module this belongs to.
      bIsVertical - if true, this is a vertical slider.
      min - the min value for the slider.
      max - the max value for the slider.
      startValue - the starting value.
      numStops - if greater than 0, this will create a discrete number of stops.

  • Method Details

    • SetRange

      public void SetRange​(double minValue, double maxValue, double startValue, int numStops)
      Sets the range of the slider.
      Parameters:
      minValue - the min value for the slider.
      maxValue - the max value for the slider.
      startValue - the starting value.
      numStops - if greater than 0, this will create a discrete number of stops.

    • GetDefaultValue

      public double GetDefaultValue()
      Gets the default or starting value of this slider.
      Returns:
      the default value.

    • DisplayValueInPercent

      public void DisplayValueInPercent​(boolean displayPercent)
      Should the control be displayed in percentage?
      Parameters:
      displayPercent - set to true to see the value in percentage form.

    • SetMidpointValue

      public void SetMidpointValue​(double value)
      Sets the mid point value. Some controls have a skewed range and the middle value is not in the center of the slider.
      Parameters:
      value - is the value at the middle of the slider.

    • SetRangeSkewValue

      public void SetRangeSkewValue​(double value, boolean skewFromCenter)
      Set a skew amount
      Parameters:
      value - is the skew amount.
      skewFromCenter - should this be skewed from the center?

    • GetMidpointValue

      public double GetMidpointValue()
      Get the mid point value of the slider.
      Returns:
      the midpoint value.

    • IsSkewedFromCenter

      public boolean IsSkewedFromCenter()
      Is it skewed from the center?
      Returns:
      true if skewed from the center.

    • GetRangeSkewValue

      public double GetRangeSkewValue()
      Get the skew amount.
      Returns:
      the skewed amount for the slider.

    • HasNonLinearRange

      public boolean HasNonLinearRange()
      Is it skewed?
      Returns:
      true if skewed

    • SetMouseDownRelativeDragMode

      public void SetMouseDownRelativeDragMode​(boolean bSetRelativeDrag)
      Determines if the slider's thumb jumps to the mouse position when clicking down.
      Parameters:
      bSetRelativeDrag - set to true to make clicking down and dragging relative to the mouse down location.

    • SetMouseSensitivity

      public void SetMouseSensitivity​(double sensitivity)
      Sets the mouse sensitivity
      Parameters:
      sensitivity - sets the mouse sensitivity indicating how far the mouse has to drag to traverse the whole range of the knob (0.1 to 4.0 ) Normal sensitivity is 1.0

    • SetSliderSize

      height - the new height

    • SetRangeMinBlankPixels

      public void SetRangeMinBlankPixels​(int numPixels)
      Shrinks the slider background at its minimum end (bottom for vertical sliders, left for horizontal sliders)
      Parameters:
      numPixels - the number of pixels by which to shrink the slider

    • GetRangeMinBlankPixels
